vulnerability_information:
Hello,
The cache-control and pragma HTTP header have not been set properly or are missing allowing the browser and proxies to cache content.

HTTP/1.1 200 OK
Connection: keep-alive
Server: gunicorn
Date: Sun, 27 Nov 2016 16:18:06 GMT
Content-Type: text/html; charset=UTF-8
X-Gratipay-Version: 2014
Set-Cookie: csrf_token=chYzzQF9UYGunrz4V68ggeuvV6MpTjTZ; expires=Sun, 04 Dec 2016 16:18:06 GMT; Path=/; secure
X-Frame-Options: SAMEORIGIN
X-Content-Type-Options: nosniff
X-Xss-Protection: 1; mode=block
Cache-Control: no-cache
Via: 1.1 vegur

Solution:
Whenever possible ensure the cache-control HTTP header is set with no-cache, no-store, must-revalidate, private; and that the pragma HTTP header is set with no-cache.
title: Incomplete or No Cache-control and Pragma HTTP Header Set

activities.markdown_message: Hey @whit537 is this report be similar to #76300 or #162336?

activities.message: Hello, the reports you given isn't public yet :)
activities.markdown_message: Hello, the reports you given isn't public yet :)

activities.message: Hmm ... #162336 is about a header but a different one (`X-XSS-Protection`). We *do* have `Cache-Control` set (as @cdqh shows). I don't know if we have another ticket about the `Pragma` header. If not we can evaluate that suggestion here. Why is `Cache-Control: no-header` not enough? Looks like the same question came up on #76300, without an answer.
activities.markdown_message: Hmm ... #162336 is about a header but a different one (X-XSS-Protection). We do have Cache-Control set (as @cdqh shows). I don't know if we have another ticket about the Pragma header. If not we can evaluate that suggestion here. Why is Cache-Control: no-header not enough? Looks like the same question came up on #76300, without an answer.

activities.message: Thanks Sir :)
activities.markdown_message: Thanks Sir :)

activities.message: Hello, Any updates?
activities.markdown_message: Hello, Any updates?

activities.message: @whit537 from what I can find in order to control caching over all different browsers these headers (all of them) are needed....... and there are issues with users hitting the back button and having the ability to view cached data/pages if the header is not set to all of these parameters.  I can send you what I have found....
activities.markdown_message: @whit537 from what I can find in order to control caching over all different browsers these headers (all of them) are needed....... and there are issues with users hitting the back button and having the ability to view cached data/pages if the header is not set to all of these parameters. I can send you what I have found....

activities.message:
Still working @cdqh !
@whit537 here is a small list of what i have found so far... 
https://isc.sans.edu/forums/diary/The+Security+Impact+of+HTTP+Caching+Headers/17033/
http://stackoverflow.com/questions/49547/how-to-control-web-page-caching-across-all-browsers/2068407#2068407

https://www.w3.org/Protocols/rfc2616/rfc2616-sec14.html  (breaks down each header )

"Pragma: no-cache Is depracated in HTTP/1.1. It is equivalent to Cache-Control: no-cache"  :https://bytes.com/topic/asp-classic/answers/499470-no-cache-vs-no-store  and https://jakearchibald.com/2016/caching-best-practices/

"Pragma: no-cache Is depracated in HTTP/1.1. It is equivalent to Cache-Control: no-cache" :https://bytes.com/topic/asp-classic/answers/499470-no-cache-vs-no-store and https://jakearchibald.com/2016/caching-best-practices/

activities.message: Any updates On this?
activities.markdown_message: Any updates On this?

activities.message:
After a review IRL w/ @dmk246, it sounds like we do have an opportunity to improve here. The SO answer and the ISC link suggest that we should set our cache headers as follows:

```
Cache-Control: private, no-cache, no-store, max-age=0
Pragma: no-cache
Expires: 0
```

Assessing as a theoretical risk, which according to our [program](https://hackerone.com/gratipay) carries a $1 bounty. Happy to reassess if you are able to provide a PoC for an attack.

Thanks, @cdqh! :-)
activities.markdown_message:

Assessing as a theoretical risk, which according to our program carries a $1 bounty. Happy to reassess if you are able to provide a PoC for an attack.

Thanks, @cdqh! :-)

activities.message: Hi @dr-cdqh ... My apologies!  We sent them to you with the address that you provided, however we have never mailed anything out your way before and have no idea how long it could take.  A colleague of ours mentioned that it could take several months to reach you.  I am sorry that I do not have an exact answer for you.  I will hope that it comes soon!!! Thanks for touching base with us and staying connected.  Let us know when they reach you!
